Reviews.Title: “Bugs and dirt !!!”
Reviews.Author: Despoinak
Reviews.Content: +nice location -dirty,spotfull carpet and towels(we spend 4 days there and nobody seemed to worry about changing them),poor breakfast,full of bed bugs(had to go to dermatologist when we returned home)too expensive considering the facilities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but better than other's we viewed!”
Reviews.Author: ellzbellz1002
Reviews.Content: After viewing a hotel which was an utter disgrace we found Armada Hotel. It was quite an expensive stay for what it was but we were told its one of the cheapest hotels. It is situated next to the canal and is only a few minutes walk to shops and Remembrandtsplein. You will definitely need a map if you're not familiar with Amsterdam. In the room we had a double bed, two bedside cabinets, a dressing table, a mirror and a TV. The TV didn't work and didn't have a remote. There were a few cigarette burns in our duvet cover (We are non-smokers and were given a 'non-smoking room' apparently). The spare pillow was covered in stains. There were water stains on the roof and we were pretty sure we could hear mice scurrying around in the walls and ceiling. There wasn't anywhere to put clothes only a shelf space. The wet room was very clean, clean toilet and sink and shower gel and shampoo was provided. The towel's that were provided were clean. The wet room did seem quite dangerous as the room seems to flood when having a shower and also there's a hair dryer in wet room which seemed a little dangerous. It is quite loud at night if you're trying to sleep (we were on the ground floor) as there's a bar next door and you can constantly hear people, music and people walking up and down the stairs to the entrance of the hotel. Breakfast was pretty poor with a choice of one type of cereal, bread rolls, cheese and 3 different types of meat and hard boiled eggs. There's a hot drinks machine also. The staff seemed okay although we didn't really interact with them much as we didn't really need to. If we visit Amsterdam again I think we'll try and look for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay H
Reviews.Content: The professional photos of this "hotel" are faked. These are not of the Armada "hotel!!" When we first arrived we were given a room on the fourth floor. We had booked and paid for a twin room and were given a tiny double. We complained at reception and were told that there were no other rooms available that night and would have to wait until the next day. The next day, we took our luggage down to reception and were told to leave it in the corner and it would be put in to our new room once it had been cleaned. We were out all day and when we arrived back at 11pm our luggage was in exactly the same place. This room was the reception, the dining area and an area to sit so we are really quite lucky that our cases were still there!!!! Our new twin room was even worse than the first. It was just as small and there was no way of sepearating the beds. It had mould on the ceiling, stains on the walls, holes in the towels and sheets, and was also right above the front door. As a result all you could hear was the music and noise from the pub next door (which has a large outside area where about 40 people a night gather until about midnight). When we tried complaining, the man on reception told us that our new room was a twin and that was the best we could expect. I tried arguing and said it was not worth the money and he actually agreed with me. It is never a good thing when the staff recognise how rubbish the hotel is!! As for breakfast.......... We had breakfast once and i would not recommend it. Disgusting. And it is taken away at 10am sharp so if you start making a cup of tea just before then, then do not expect to be able to have milk with it!!! I would not call this building a hotel. It is a hostel!!! And not a good hostel!! It is dirty and stuck in the 80s and is also a death trap. I think the idea is that the bathroom is a wet room but when the water from the shower covers the entire floor and the stream covers every inch of the wall (including the hair dryer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) then you are taking a risk in this hotel. I wish i had read more reviews before i stayed in this hovel because then i would not out of pocket of 700 euro for 4 night!! (not to mention a 5% tourist tax and 3% chargs for using a credit card which they also add on!) It has even put me off visiting Amsterdam again. I urge all rational people not to stay in this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “How did this hotel get two stars???”
Reviews.Author: StarTrips000
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this hotel received two stars in the first place! It's the worst hotel we ever stayed! It was tiny, torn, dirty, and expensive! The only good thing is its location - 5 mintues walk from Rembrandtsplein. The room we stayed in had two twin beds pushed together - one higher than the other. The blankets were so thin and had lots of holes in it! The mattresses were so uncomfortable that I woke up every moring with a back, shoulder and neck pain! There was only 1 night stand with a telephone on it, and only a single chair on the other side of the bed. We didn't dare to sit on that chair because it barely could stand itself! No wall or any protection separating between the toilet and shower - so the bathroom floor was mostly flooded. The exhaust fan didn't work because the steam stayed in the bathroom for the whole night when we kept the bathroom door closed! One last thing I have to mention that's absolutely ridiculous and amusing too was when we asked for the final bill with the exact rate for each night we stayed there, the staff simply replied "it's impossible"! :-P There only listed the rate for the 1st night we stayed there, and apparently, the remaining two nights were more expensive. We were told the rate for the remaining two nights verbally, but "it's impossible" to be printed on the final bill. They could only print the rate for the 1st night and then a total figure. BTW, we could never add up to the total figure with the rates they told us verbally! After arguing with the staff trying to figure out how he came up with the total amount, he manually did some calculation with a calculator and hand-correted some figures on the bill, then told us we didn't pay them enough! WHAT A JOKE!

Reviews.Title: “ALSO CALLED ARMADA CANALVIEW HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: alwaystravelin225
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is very pleasant. Unfortunately, the standard of hotels in general in Amsterdam is rather low. While we were there, there was an article that said Amsterdam was voted to have the dirtiest hotels in Europe overall. This is mostly bc people are so into the "uniqueness" of it (parties, weed, prostitution), that they don't mind inadequate hotels and the standard gets lowered. + This hotel is a 15 minute or so walk to the central station. + It's a great location overall and there is a canal right outside. (I'm not sure how many rooms have a view of it though). + Breakfast is buffet style and starts at 7:00 a.m.: rolls, salami, ham & cheese, orange juice, milk, two types of cereal, coffee and tea. +The people downstairs are friendly; always available to answer questions plus they take your key before you leave and return it when you get back. *Although one day we were leaving early for a day trip and even though the guy had taken out all the breakfast he said we coulldn't have any because it wasn't 7:00 yet. He was also pouring himself juice while he said it!) + There's a small basic television in the room with a few channels in English. + It's basic and clean; gets cleaned every day - There's no air conditioner in the room which, surprisingly, is a little bit of a problem because it's warmer upstairs than outside. We slept on top of the covedrs every night except for one. - The window is permanently opened, (at least while we were there) and the guests have no control over it. It doesn't create a privacy issue because of the curtains, but a couple bugs flew in at night when we only had one or two lights on. - It's nice to be central but the hotel is RIGHT next to a bar so if you are a light sleeper-and you plan on sleeping:) - you may not want to stay there. The party ends late EVERY night. - This hotel is best for people who pack lightly. This hotel, like mostly everywhere in The Netherlands and throughout Europe has very narrow stairs and no elevator that i know of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little worn, but overall clean”
Reviews.Author: Fl2urist
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here, and found the hotel to be a little worn, but overall clean and safe. We found it's location to be awesome, as it is centrally located, and only a short walk from tourist areas, such as the casino or Dam Square. There is a pub right in front, which stays pretty busy til midnight or so. The trolleys are nearby, and bars and restaurants are as well. The breakfast is ok, though not especially thrilling. If you are looking for a value-priced hotel, near the center of town, this hotel will serve you well...

Reviews.Title: “NEVER again here”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy1223344332
Reviews.Content: This sure is a place NOT to recommend, in my opinion. Iâ€™ve spent 900 euro for me and my wife for 7 days, and read what happened. First, the day we arrived weâ€™ve been given a room at the ground floor, where there barely was space to open the door. The window was 2 meters away from a bar entrance, so it was like chaos and noises until 2am in the night. We then asked for another room, and we got a bigger one at the last floor. Different room, different problems: - The elevator was out of order two days out of three, and when it was â€œworkingâ€�, we just had to keep the button pushed until we reached our floor! If it was not kept pushed, the elvator would just stop. Also, it was extremely slow (a few seconds were necessary to get to the next floor, no matter the direction) - the wi-fi was not present at all on our floor, so no internet connection for our mobiles; - the shower could not stay attached to the wall, therefore we had to find a way to wash ourselves somehow (what about shampoo?); also, there was no protection to prevent the water get out on the floor, therefore youâ€™d better expect kind of a flood in the bathroom every time you have a shower; - the lights near the bed pillows were not working; I reported this to the guy at the reception andâ€¦ he wanted to give me a new light bulb to change it myself! If you consider that it was like I had to undo half of the room to change them, that was not a possible answer at all (and Iâ€™m quite a handy one). - There was just one small wardrobe, and the room was for two. If you plan just to make a little shopping around (but even if you donâ€™t), consider you will just have to lay all your dresses upon your luggage (good luck if you want to find something in it!) - The bed sheets and the towels were torn and with holes - The walls were dirty here and there - Talking about our bed, the mattress really was abasolutely concave, to the point my wife and couldnâ€™t but sleep totally pressed on each other. - The pillows were of such a poor quality that I woke up every morning with quite a pain in my neck. I usually travel quite much, and this has been my worst hotel experience so far. Ok, itâ€™s a two stars hotel, but this means â€œfew comfort, but workingâ€�, not â€œfew comfort, and not even workingâ€�!!! I know well all the other hotels were more expensive, but with a few more euro Iâ€™d have just got in a some far better one (Eden, for example, but thereâ€™s plenty out there). Also, I always try to save on hotels when I travel, and despite this Iâ€™ve never had such an awful experience even when I visited Turkey or Egypt.

Reviews.Title: “Think No Frills and then lower your expectations some more”
Reviews.Author: CaribGirl101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like the pictures so be careful. We had a large room for 6 people which was basically the attic and to be honest it was more like a hostel than a hotel. It was beyond basic and this would be ok if you were expecting to stay at a 1* hotel. This is not a 3* hotel so be warned. After the initial shock of seeing our room, stained walls, dirty floor and all and an unsuccessful attempt at arguing for a better room we had to stay. The beds although being really soft were clean and the bathroom was ok so from that perspective it was bareable to stay in for 3 nights. Breakfast is rubbish, but the location is good. The lift could only fit one person at a time and was broken for most of our stay anyway, so we didn't enjoy carting our suitcases up 4 flights of steep stairs. There were also paint works taking place whilst we were there but this didn't disturb or affect us at all. This hotel is perfect for those who just want a base camp for their holiday and are not intending to spend much time in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KBuitenhuis
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 and 1/2 nights. Saw blood on the sheets after night one. Woke up the middle of the second night with bedbugs crawling all over us. They gave us another room, but would you sleep in another room? We camped out in the lobby until the owner was contacted. He agreed to give us our money back for that night, but not the first! Hotel staff were lovely but the owner - not so much!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: projectkevin
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly not a hotel. It's a hostel... and one not worth the price at the door. For the same price you can get better accommodation and without a death trap of a lift. Staff were always surprised by any questions and had no info on tourist activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: chugzy
Reviews.Content: The Armada is located on the Keizersgracht near the Amstel River, a few blocks from Rembrandtplein in Amsterdam. Our room was on the 4th floor with a view to the canal. Like most hotel rooms in Amsterdam, it was small, but comfortable for the price of 80 Euros per night for the two of us. The room was equipped with a small sink/toilet/shower combo, and had a fairly new LCD TV. The hotel offered a buffet breakfast included in the price. The hotel has an elevator, but it was laughingly slow, and one has to hold the button down to keep it moving. Overall, no complaints, and it was only 5 Euros more per night than the hell-hole we stayed in a couple of weeks earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: denoobie
Reviews.Content: Nothing in this hotel is as stated in the 'blurb' Triple rooms are not large and airy - barely enough room to get around the beds. We had to sit on the bed if any of us wanted to move around. Wardrobe space is minimal. Ensuite bathroom was a small 'wet pod' in the corner of the room. Decor is dreadful, windows are rotting around the frames, paint is scratched and chipped, carpets could really do with a good clean or replaced. I travelled with an elderly relative, we were on 2nd floor, and the lift would only take one person at a time. The floor button had to be held the whole time, if not the lift just stopped. The only thing going for this hotel was the location. Breakfast was a joke, for continental it was sparse and uninteresting, ham/cheese/jam/boiled egg/orange juice/tea & coffee. Not worth the price we paid, roughly Â£200.00 per person for a 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Steep price to stay in something equal to a hostel”
Reviews.Author: iamspecialized
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our original hotel only to be told our reservation had been canceled. There was another party with the same problem. Both of us were moved to the Armada. We were told when leaving that the Armada had agreed to pay the taxi but that never happened when we arrived. The price for the room plus the 3% credit card surcharge was high IMO. However, there was a convention in town and the only other available rooms were at the airport. The staff was nice and helpful accept for one man who worked the desk and smoked in the lobby and in the halls. This was an employee, not a guest. The room we were assigned was in the basement with a window directly next to an outside bar. We never got any sleep and you could hear people in the hall most of the night. I guess the room was clean and the bathroom was basic, but the room did not give me an comforting feeling. This is one step or equal to a hostel. I do not recommend it to anyone give the price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, value”
Reviews.Author: shilam
Reviews.Content: I moved from one hotel to this one, which I was so pleased about, the room were just the right size, it had an elevator, breakfast is included in the price, its not a luxury hotel but has everything you would require from hairdryer, breakfast, tv, phone, lift, is close to everything and very very helpful staff. Its a lively area and the tram service is a 30 second walk with everything else within reach of minutes, I cant thank the owner enought for taking pity on us with the problems we had on the previous hotel (hotel hermitage), lovely man and would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Aughie
Reviews.Content: I have never written a bad review before, if I wasn't happy with my experience I would tend to just chalk it down to experience, however..... First with the good points.. the location as everyone says is excellent, and the staff were friendly, but that's the end of the positive stuff. The rooms are tiny and seriously basic which you could get over if you weren't being charged a ridiculous price. We were not able to pass each other anywhere in the room, one person had to stand back to let the other by. I did ask to be moved after the first night but was told the only other available room was of the same size. It didn't help to realize that at the time of checking in the couple before us paid the same price (actually slightly cheaper because they didn't pay the 3% credit card surcharge) but for a canal view room, whereas we got to look at the back of an assortment of buildings - not pretty. The breakfast was also extremely basic. For the same price in Ireland you would get a double room in a 4* hotel with a leisure centre. I'm sorry to say but this hotel is more representative of an old hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickster14
Reviews.Content: Good location and the staff were very friendly. I would recomend that you book a double room and not a twin if possible, the doubles are much much more spacious (twice as big) and are on the top floor away from the noise, we however stayed in the twin room which is on the ground floor, so our window was literally on the street, it was so noisy and we couldn't open our window as we were worried about passers by reaching in. Room was clean although the bed mattress was like sleeping on a sponge. You could hear people coming and going from reception at all hours and one morning a lady was doing the hoovering at 8am and banging the hoover into our door...what a lovely wake up call!! My hubby was fine as he can sleep through anything - wish I could!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought , or read.....”
Reviews.Author: Phicus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over a weekend. The hotel was booked by a friend for a group of us and, after looking at some previous reviews we were a little worried to say the least. It didn't turn out to be as bad as we though and, for the price, in Amsterdam it was OK. Good location right on the corner of Two of the main streets with a great little restarant and, bar right outside on the canal. The reception and, hallways look a little tatty and, could do with some new lights and, a paint job but, the room was adequate except one of the panes on the window was broken and, let a breeze in which is good because there is NO A/C and, it was pretty hot with the Sun beating down through the window and, thin curtains in the morning. Those of us who had a big night were less than pleased. The Bathroom had been refurbished into a Wet room recently so it worked. The reception staff were not that freindly and, there was a little noise at night from people walking down the hallways. There is nowhere to store luggage securely on departure you just leave it in a pile in the dining room but there is always someone at the reception watching it. We felt reasonably safe in our room though. Bring your change as the most wonderful addition to any hotel awaits you in the lobby. A beer vending machine, this was a godsend after the long walk home from some of the Bars that had closed in the early hours. Dont expect too much, get out and about in Amsterdam and, you should enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap,Dirty and Good”
Reviews.Author: Brabonian
Reviews.Content: Went there with a mate in Nov 07 hoping to finally see some of the cultural side of Amsterdam. The location of the hotel is superb. Theres a tram right outside and you're a 20 min walk either north to the red light area or south to the museums and my favourite square in Amsterdam is literally right around the corner. The hotel itself is dirty - but i didnt care, I wouldnt go there with my wife but for a "lads weekend away" its just fine. The stairs up to the rooms are a tad precarious and i wouldnt recommend an unfit person books in here. Breakfast was basic but adequate, rolls, cheese, ham, coffee, cereal etc... If that doesnt sound good theres a really friendly coffee shop about 10m from the door that does nice food. The room was tiny - mine was billed as a double but was an ok size for a single, i certainly wouldnt want to try and fit 2 people into it. The bathroom again was tiny but really well designed as a mini wet room - I've considered modelling my own bathroom at home on something similar after being there. The staff were friendly enough and the price was one of the cheapest we could get with our late booking. Overall i'm pleased with the Armada - its good value for Â£Â£, I'd go back like a shot with my mates but would maybe think twice about going with my wife

Reviews.Title: “Awful to a point where its actually comical”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the armada for 3 nights over New Year. We paid quite a lot of money for this period. The location is great on the corner of the Keizersgracht and the Utrechtsestraat close to the Rembrantplein and on the tram line. I am a frequent visitor to Amsterdam and this is one of my favorite parts of the city. I love the bustling local life. Unfortunately we couldn't get into our usual hotel so the Armada had to do. The reception area was ok and this room doubled as the breakfast area, which again, was just ok. The communal areas and the hallways/ stairways were incredibly poorly maintained and of very low (lower than hostel) standards. The carpets had been ripped up the walls were bearing electrical wires. the lights were out and the floor and walls were covered in mystery stains. I think they were renovating part of it but for me it needs to be rebuilt entirely. Our room was tiny but had an excellent view of the canal and the main street. It was up 4 flights of stairs and the lift was out though so this was very tiring, though we tended to spend no time in the hotel at all, no point when you're in amsterdam. On more than one occasion did we see strange people wandering the halls or plastering in their underwear. Surreal experience, like being in an eastern european hostel at Marriot prices! I wouldn't stay here again, if it was mega cheap then I would overlook all its horrible failings, but it's not. It didn't ruin our break, it would take a lot to ruin a holiday in the Dam for me. We just spent our time laughing at how horrible it was! Don't bother unless its the last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Shady practices with debit cards”
Reviews.Author: Argyllman
Reviews.Content: The setting of this hotel is good, but it is nothing special in itself. Watch out though. They took an unauthorised sum of money from our debit card after we had left and 3 months later have failed to reply to all approaches by me and my bank to have it repaid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only for the location!”
Reviews.Author: kgodbolt
Reviews.Content: Went with a good friend - we were only really bothered about our hotel being central as we weren't planning on spending much time in our room, so for this, Hotel Armada was perfect. Our room was small & bathroom tiny, but perfectly clean and we actually had a view of the canal, as promised in the hotel name!! So that was one pleasant surprise. The communal stairwell and other areas are falling down and filthy, it has to be said, but the room was cheap and we were really pleased with being so central so we just go on with it and had a great time out in Amsterdam! Didn't bother trying breakfast in the hotel as tehre was a lovely bakery on the corner and it was only a couple of minutes walk up to the shops. There's a tram stop right outside the hotel which takes you straight to Central Station too.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but will not return”
Reviews.Author: Ninjaman0714
Reviews.Content: If you book a budget hotel, do not expect a 5-star hotel - once you consciously realize this, then the Hotel Armada doesn't look that bad. There were some good aspects. However, there were many things I was displeased about. To start with the good - the hotel is situated in a relatively quiet part of the town, somewhat central between sites like the Anne Frank House, Heineken Brewery, King's Square, and Damrak and Dam Square and the Red Light District. There are several eating places relatively closeby, within 10-13 minutes walk, so transport is not much of an issue. The hotel breakfast, while very basic, was edible and given the hotel rating, quite good in my opinion. On the negative side - the rooms did not have any heating or cooling, so temperature was controlled via opening and closing windows. The rooms were not very impressive, but such can be expected in a budget hotel. My room was on the 4th floor, and overlooking the back of the building, which looked somewhat like a ghetto. The bathroom had no shower curtain, so water would spray all over the ground when showering. The rooms were relatively clean, though it could have been a bit better. People complain about the steps being too steep, and no lift, but that will be an issue in any budget hotel in Amsterdam, so I will not say any more on that. Overall, the hotel served it's purpose for me, which was somewhere to sleep and shower. However, if returning to Amsterdam, I think there might be a few options a bit more comfortable around the same price range, and I would probably look for something a bit closer to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “No Way”
Reviews.Author: Roaringdog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really in quite terrible condition. The stairway up to the rooms and the carpet is really awful - huge stains everywhere. We had to book a quad (and pay for it) even though there were only two of us. There was a toenail in my bed that did NOT belong to me. The young man at the desk was nice enough but it was a real shocker when we got to the hotel. It cost about 210.00 dollars for the one night and it was the worst place (and unfortunately the last place) we stayed on our three and one-half sojourn through Europe for our 40th anniversary. Yes, there is a lovely view but if you are worried about bugs, it doesn't do much good. Someone is making a killing on this place - so they should improve it. All in all, quite creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Its not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: stevef07
Reviews.Content: Went here whilst on a stag weekend in amsterdam in mid-june. This is a good hotel to stay in for a weekend, not for longer though. Its within 15 minutes walk from everything, and has a tram stop right outside. Wasn't a big fan of the breakfast though. Best thing was our room. Had practically the whole top floor to ourselves as we were a party of 10. Room was massive with a very nice bathroom. only downside was splattered mosquitoes were not cleaned off wall, though there were only a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, spartan and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ZocLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2007. Exceptionally well placed, clean sheets and friendly reception. That's the good stuff. A lot of stairs, smoky smell, dirty carpets, filthy walls and not a sparkling bathroom plus exceptionally irritating and incompetent cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Silicon_Surfer
Reviews.Content: The location is about the only thing to commend about this hotel. It's about a 15 minute walk from Dam square, but a nice walk. Sadly the actual hotel is nowhere near as pleasant. I arrived on a friday evening and was given an ensuite room. Unfortunately this room was next to the toilet, so everytime it was used I got woken up (and it was being used until about 5am). The room itself was very basic and the decor far too dirty. The bedding didn't smell particularly pleasant. The next morning I asked to be moved to another hotel and was transferred to their sister hotel closer to Dam square (a huge improvement). If you were paying Â£30, or â‚¬50 a night for this place it would be fine, but I was paying â‚¬100 and that really wasn't fine. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel Armada to find a room that was dark and filthy, with peeling wall paper, water stains on the walls and ceilings, dirty carpeting, worn out mattress, and a smell that was indescribable. It was not fit for human habitation. When I informed the proprietor that I would not be staying the proprietor insisted that I pay for the first night --in cash! I was forced to find another hotel. I chose the Hotel Le Coin a few blocks away and was provided with an excellent clean comfortable room with more amenities (fridge, microwave, sink) at a similar price. I would not recomend the Hotel Armada to anyone. Amsterdam has far better choices at similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay @ Armada”
Reviews.Author: fivetimesbaby
Reviews.Content: 18/0506 - 21/05/06. I have recently stayed in the Armada during a 3 day break with a group of friends and stayed in a triple room with en suite bathroom. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and of reasonable size. Although the carpet was a bit grubby the room was clean and fresh towels provided every day. Breakfast was also adequate. Cereal was provided but it was mainly buffet style, ham, cheese, salami and fresh buns coffee and fresh orange. You could basically have as much as you wanted. Although we never spent much time in the hotel we all found it comfortable and clean. The staff were also very helpful an example of which was when we arrived back to the hotel one night with a couple of bottles of cold beverages. Unfortunately we did not have a bottle opener so we asked the guy on reception. After being told he could not find one from the kitchen he knocked on our room about 5 minutes later with a pair of pliers, which did the job. If you are just looking for basic comfortable accommodation for a short stay then this hotel is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there! You have been warned!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Armada 5 days. We were 5 peoople (in a double and a three people bedroom) and had to pay 127 Euros each for 4 nights, which is just way overpriced for the conditions I found the hotel in. The window in the room could not be opened properly, the ceiling was dirty and broken, I thought it would come down any moment. There is only one toilet and shower per floor, the shower is not working properly and genereally they are just in a state of disgusting filth. Having only one (unisex) shower and toilet is illegal under German laws, but I do not know about the Dutch law regarding those things. The breakfast was ok, some cheap cheese, salami and chocolate spread, it normally lasts until 10.30 (as we were told and as it says in the "house rules") but on our last morning, we were not given any breakfast and told it had finished at 10. Upon our arrival we were also told that some builders were working in the hotel, but that we should not be disturbed, we were a bit confused that we were not told so earlier and became very angry when we were awoken one morning at 10 by very loud hammer and drilling sounds. Two other weird and unpleasant things occured, the cleaner lady actually put stuff belonging to my friend, deep in his bag, consequently going through his stuff, another time we were awakened by some member of staff opening the door of our room (with his card) and quickly shutting it again. Overall the Hotel Armada is filthy (but with nice staff) and totally overpriced! Do not go there, I cannot understand all other reviewers who are giving 5 stars!!! You have been warned....

Reviews.Title: “simple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...Hotel is well situated. the hotel, room, breakfast was good not relevant but for a 2stars! Just a negativ point was the cleaning of the room (in apparence clean but not so !!) The personnel was helpful! the price was without suprise. Nice hotel, nice prices but a bit cleaner would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a room via the internet, and the pictures you see on their site must have been taken 20 years ago, with no updating or significant cleaning done since then. They messed up our reservation, which resulted in a basement-level room. It smelled like smoke and urine, and was quite dark and dirty. It was more reminiscent of a â‚¬35/night hostel than of a hotel (I think 1-Star is more appropriate). They guy at the desk tried to tell me that the normal price of the room was â‚¬135, and we were 'getting a deal' at â‚¬90!!! (we found a room around the corner for â‚¬80 which was 10 times nicer). Overall, the value of the Hotel Armada is minimal, and if you prefer staying in dingy, dark, dank, dirty rooms in Amsterdam to make you feel like you got a deal, this is your place. I think the Hotel Armada may have been a nice place to stay a decade ago, but someone must have purchased it with the intent of making as much money as possible. I feel like they are internet predators, as we found no way to contact them other than e-mail, so you really don't know what you are getting until you walk in the door. I only wish I'd thought to take a picture so I could share with you all the actual value of this place compared to what is typical for Amsterdam. If you are used to 'youth hostel' accommodations, you'll be right at home, but you'll be paying the same as a 3-Star hotel, but getting 1-Star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Hotel Armada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this through the Internet, and it was not as described. The photographs of the rooms and the restaurant area that we saw on the Internet were completely different from what we saw when we got there. The rooms were shabby, dark and not clean. The entry and eating area looked more like a youth hostel than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: markh
Reviews.Content: ok they advertise this hotel as a 2 star and thats what it is is a 2 star hotel. there is nothing fancy here. my single room was very large for adam standards. the breakfast was nothing more than bread cheese and salami. coffee and o.j. too in the room the hot water didnt last very long and the window witch were very large didnt lock witch was a little concern of mine but they do have a safe at the reception desk for your personal stuff. now the location of this hotel can not be beat. and this is the only reason i will stay again at this hotel. there are so many bars, cafes, pubs and restaurants with in a 5 minute walk. and yes coffeeshops too. i dont think i left a 1 mile radius of the hotel the entire week. everything you need is right there. for 80 euro's a night its not bad at all. ill be back.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location, but not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Armada in October of 2003. The room was spacious and clean. Our room was in the building adjacent to the hotel which must have been a private apartment building as it definitely didn'tfeel too much like a hotel. The staff were friendly, but I had a bad experience with the the front desk woman. I found the drinking glasses in our room were dirty and I asked for new ones. She not only told me they didn't have any more (not true, I could see them from the bar) but she actually asked me why did I come all the way down from my room rather than wash them myself. Are you kidding me? That was ridiculous. I wish I had said something really mean to her. Also, the sheets don't get changed everyday. All in all, this is a good place to stay while you're visiting the coffee shops and enjoying the charms of Amsetrdam, but I wouldn't consider it much of a hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my friend and i stayed at the armada, nov 2002, the sevice was great, the staff were very helpful, the rooms were excellent, i think overall that the armada is an excellent choice if you are going to amsterdam, when i return i will book my accomodations there.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Armada hotel. The staff was very kind and helpfull and the rooms we had were clean and comftable. The hotel is in the center of Amsterdam and don't buy a full-day or a 3-day tramticket because everything is in walking distance. We will be back next time in Armada hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel we booked over the internet & it was the furthest thing from the description given that you could imagine. It was filthy with the dirt, there was a horrid smell in the hallways & 1 room was tiny.

HotelInfo.Name: Armada Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Keizersgracht 713 - 715, Amsterdam 1017 DX, The Netherlands
